subject: She's back!
header: After some time off to get married, I'm back at it this week, and trying to get back into the swing of things. I could carry on at some length about my amazing husband (those of you who know me on Facebook have no-doubt gotten sick of it by now), but I sha'nt. Instead, on to the week's news!

entries.title: Timeouts for Parallel::ForkManager
entries.author: doug_bell
entries.text: Doug hacks a bit to prevent hung tests by implementing a timeout on the ForkManager.

entries.title: Virtual Spring Cleaning Interlude: A herd of yaks, all waiting to be shaved
entries.author: max_maischein
entries.text: Max takes a swing at a couple of slow-burning projects.

entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: April 4-10
entries.author: sawyer_x

entries.title: You won't believe this one quick Perl 6 optimization hack!
entries.author: jeff_goff
entries.text: Jeff clickbaits us, then shows a quick hack that speeds things up in the Perl6::Parser test suite.

entries.title: All things being equal, not all things are eqv
entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: Perl 6 has a wealth of comparison operators! brian d foy gives us a rundown, and an admonishment about making rash assumptions.

entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

entries.title: French Perl Workshop
entries.text: The French Perl Workshop will be held in Paris Jun 9-10.

entries.title: Perl Toolchain Summit
entries.text: Formerly known as the Perl QA Hackathon, this year's Toolchain Summit will be held May 11-14 in Lyon, France.

entries.title: The Perl Conference - Amsterdam
entries.text: Formerly YAPC::EU, the conference's theme this year is 'High-end Perl'. Call for Presentations remains open until June 15!

entries.title: The Perl Conference - US
entries.text: Registration is now open for the US Perl Conference (formerly YAPC::NA)!
